words.word_definition: The act of unlawfully killing someone with premeditation or intent.
examples: The suspect was accused of murdering his business partner.
Murdering innocent civilians is considered a war crime.

words.word_definition: Causing or likely to cause horror; shocking and frightful.
examples: The accident scene was a horrible sight.
They had a horrible experience during their vacation.

words.word_definition: The topic or theme of a discussion, book, work of art, etc.
examples: The subject matter of the painting was the French Revolution.
The professor's lecture covered a wide range of subject matter.

words.word_definition: Wider in scope or more comprehensive than something else.
examples: We need to take a broader view of the problem.
The new policy has broader implications for the entire industry.

words.word_definition: Connected or related to something else.
examples: Smoking is associated with an increased risk of lung cancer.
The company and its associated businesses have a global presence.
